metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3745 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow issue was found in ImageMagick's PushCharPixel() function in quantum-private.h. This issue may allow a local attacker to trick the user into opening a specially crafted file, triggering an out-of-bounds read error and allowing an application to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3
imagemagick-6-common - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3
imagemagick-6.q16hdri - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3

No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3').
